title: Occult - Rosicrucian Texts Vol 1 (pdf) EarthBow
description:
No study of the occult would be complete without at least a passing knowledge of the "Order of the Rosy Cross" or Rosicrucians.

Although probably of far more ancient origins, the "modern" Rosicrucians can trace roots back to about 1407. The first written record dates to about 1610, with the publication of the "Fama Fraternitatis" (The Fame of the Brotherhood), and Confessio Fraternitatis (The Confession of the Brotherhood), both possibly written by Francis Bacon. 

In more modern times, groups claiming to be based on Rosicrucian principals can be divided into 3 basic groups: 

1... Esoteric Christian groups, who seek understanding of the hidden teachings of Christ. The "Rosicrucian Fellowship" is probably the best known of these groups.

2... Masonic Rosicrucian groups, like the "Societas Rosicruciana in Anglia" (probably best known for the writings of AE Waite)

3... Initiatory groups such as the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn and the Ordo Templi Orientis.

There are a bewildering array of books available on the topic. The ones I selected here present a fairly accurate and well-balanced overview of the Rosicrucians. You may note that most of these are older titles. I feel that they are closer in time to the original teachings of the Rosicrucians, and so present a view less distorted.


This torrent contains...         (all .pdf format)

Unknown - Fama Fraternitatis, c.1610, 21 pages

Unknown - Confessio Fraternitatis, c.1614, 18 pages

Jennings, Hargrave - The Rosicrucians, 1870, 391 pages

Waite, Arthur - The Real history of the Rosicrucians, 1887, 462 pages

Reader, A - Mysteries of the Rosie Cross, 1891, 152 pages

Heindel, Max - Gleanings of a Mystic, 1922, 216 pages

Heindel, Max - The Rosicrucian Cosmo-Conception, 1911, 620 pages

Heindel, Max - The Rosicrucian Mysteries, 1916, 216 pages

Heindel, Max - The Rosicrucian Philosophy in Questions and Answers, 1922, 456 pages

Hamil, John - The Rosicrucian Seer, 1987, 220 pages



Note: I will be adding many more titles soon, Search for "EarthBow" for a list of available titles.

As always, comments (good or bad) are appreciated

Keywords: occult, esoteric, rosy cross, rosicrucians, freemason, masonic, golden dawn, history
